name: Goblin Reclaimers
background:
Goblins are diminutive creatures using salvaged technology, strange mutations, and sheer weight of numbers. Emerging from their remote planet in the wake of a devastating nuclear blast that wiped out the human colonists on the surface, the Goblins have wasted little time spreading out to nearby worlds and scavenging any technology they find.

They are forever seeking new and intriguing life forms and technology, but their penchant for destruction often results in them leaving their new homes every bit as irradiated as their first.
backgroundFull:
The Goblins long dwelt deep beneath the surface of their world, emerging to the surface only in times of desperation to forage and hunt what they could from the surface. None know for certain what initially drove them underground; some Goblin legends speak of a great war, but most claim that their ancestors have always lived this way. For much of their history, their world was ignored by the larger species until it came to be settled by a group of Human renegades seeking a world where they could operate outside of the confines of the Great Human Alliance.

The Goblins readily embraced their new neighbours, emerging at night to visit the ever-growing Human cities. The Humans and Goblins formed a strange friendship, with Goblins offering help and supplies to the newly settled colonists while the Humans gave them gadgets and tools. Close to a century of collaboration ended with a series of earth-shaking explosions that nearly sealed them forever inside of their caves.

Seeking to escape their now crumbling homes, the Goblins fled onto the surface. There, they discovered that the Humans had disappeared but left behind a wealth of technology and infrastructure for them to use, though much of it was badly in need of their unique touch for repairs, and other parts seemed to bring on strange changes in the Goblins. Some saw this as another odd gift left by their former companions, while others exercised greater caution.

Remembering that the Humans came from the stars, the Goblins wasted no time in seeking out and assembling space-worthy ships to seek out their companions. Eventually, they did encounter Humans among the stars, but these ones didnâ€™t recognise the Goblins and had little time for their antics, treating them as annoyances rather than friends. Dejected but not unwilling to give up hope of reunion, the Goblins continue to seek out their old friends and new gadgets among the stars, even as many find their chaotic outlook to be more dangerous than endearing.

What treasures will you find among the stars?

spells.name: Ammo Boost
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Mischievous Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Zap!
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Surge.

spells.name: Mob Frenzy
spells.effect: Pick up to four enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets AP(1) when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Boom!
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which take 1 hit with Blast(3) each.

spells.name: Shroud Field
spells.effect: Pick up to six friendly units within 12", which get +1 to defense rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getUnitBaseCostDiff({ quality: 4, defense: 5, tough: 2, rules: ["Tough"] }, { defense: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Pow!
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 6", which take 1 hit with AP(2) and Skewer each.

specialRules.name: Mischievous
specialRules.description: When attacking, targets must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6 when blocking hits from this model's weapons.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Instinctive
specialRules.description: When this model is activated, if it is able to shoot/charge an enemy unit, then it must immediately attack the closest valid target and gets +1 to hit rolls for that attack.

specialRules.name: Good Shot
specialRules.description: This model gets +1 to hit rolls when shooting.

specialRules.name: Re-Deployment
specialRules.description: After all other units are deployed (excluding units that were set aside), you may remove up to two friendly units from the table and deploy them again. Players alternate in placing Re-Deployment units, starting with the player that activates next.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Precision Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to hit rolls in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Mischievous Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Mischievous Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Retaliate
specialRules.description: When this model takes a wound in melee, the attacker takes X hits.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Quick Shot. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Regeneration Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Regeneration. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Melee Evasion. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Skewer
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and against non-Hero units with Tough(3) or more, this weapon gets Deadly(+3).

specialRules.name: Dangerous Terrain Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which must immediately take a Dangerous Terrain test.

specialRules.name: Piercing Shooting Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets AP(+1) when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Courage Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to morale test rolls. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Mischievous Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Mischievous, enemies taking hits from it must re-roll successful unmodified defense results of 5-6 from Mischievous (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Quick
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2â€ when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot
specialRules.description: This model may shoot after using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds donâ€™t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as enemy models in the target unit and within 3â€ of it. Hits must be split evenly between all enemy units within 3â€ of any model from the target (defender picks how).

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).
